Susie Homeyer
Contact Susie Homeyer Phone: (936) 825-6408 The City Secretary is responsible for performing the administrative duties of the Office of the City Secretary as set forth by the Texas Local Government Code. The City Secretary is also responsible for:
  • Maintaining and recording official City documents;

Cary Bovey
Contact Cary Bovey Phone:( 512) 904-9441 Prior to founding the Law Office of Cary L. Bovey, PLLC in 2009, Cary co-founded the firm of Bovey & Bojorquez. He worked in a thriving solo practice and was an associate with Brown McCarroll Sheets & Crossfield, LLP, and a shareholder in Sheets & Crossfield, PC, where his practice focused on serving municipal clients. Much of Cary's experience was obtained as Assistant General Counsel for the Texas Municipal League (TML). Cary received his Doctor of Jurisprudence from the University of Texas School of Law and his Bachelor of Arts in Political Science from Texas A&M University. He is active in his community's youth sports activities and has served on the Charter Review Commission and the Local Law Enforcement Block Grant Advisory Board for the City of Round Rock. Navasota Municipal Building 200 E. McAlpine Street, Room 210 Navasota, TX 77868 Law Office of Cary L. Bovey, PLLC 2251 Double Creek Drive, Suite 204 Round Rock, TX 78664

William A. "Bert" Miller, III
bmiller@navasotatx.gov Phone: (936) 825-6475

William A. Bert Miller, III is a product of Navasota High School and attended Stephen F. Austin University and Blinn College. Bert is President of Miller Insurance Agency and has been with the agency since 1997. Prior to this position, he worked as a sales representative with Trinity Industries for 8 years. Bert’s experience comes from his overwhelmingly positive attitude and desire to make Navasota a great place to be.

  • Mayor, City of Navasota, Texas
  • City Councilmember, City of Navasota, Texas
  • Board Member, Navasota Economic Development Corporation
  • Board Member, Brazos Valley Council of Governments
  • Member, Past President, Navasota Kiwanis Club
  • Board Member, Grimes County Crimestoppers
  • Board Member, Past Chairman, Grimes County Health Resource Commission
  • Board Member, Past Chairman, Navasota ISD Education Foundation
  • Member, 100 Club
  • Member, Washington-On-The-Brazos Park Association
  • Member, Independent Insurance Agents of Texas; Leadership Academy, 2012
  • Member, Navasota Theater Alliance
  • Member, Arts Council Brazos Valley
  • Board Member, Workforce Solutions Brazos Valley
  • Member, Brazos Valley Regional Review Committee
  • Member, Grimes St. Joseph Healthcare Council
  • Past Board Member, Texas Municipal League
  • Member, Texas Workforce Commission Adult Education & Literacy Advisory Committee
  • Member, Grimes Co. Agrilife Extension Leadership Advisory Board
  • Member, Grimes Co. Juvenile Deliquency Prevention Coalition
  • Eagle Scout, 1983
  • Organized & Past President, Grimes County Junior Chamber of Commerce
  • District Director, Regional Director, Community VP, Texas Junior Chamber of Commerce, 1992 - 1997
  • Past Chairman, City of Navasota Parks & Recreation Advisory Board, 1999 - 2005
James D. Harris
jharris@navasotatx.gov Phone: (936) 825-6475

James Harris graduated from Navasota High School in 1983.  After graduation, James became the manager of the local Western Auto Store which he had been working at since the sixth grade.  His job duties at the beginning included such things as putting bicycles together, but he eventually worked his way up to installing tires, salesman, and then store manager.   James then started his own business in 1987 known as Harris Texaco.  Ten years later Harris Tire was born, and that is still what it is known by today.

  • Sponsors Rattlers of the Week for the Navasota Examiner
  • President of the Progressive Outreach Center
Josh M. Fultz
jfultz@navasotatx.gov Phone: (936) 825-6475 Josh graduated from Navasota High School in 1996. After high school Josh attended Sam Houston State University where he graduated with a Bachelor of Science Degree in Criminal Justice. He worked for the Judicial District Community Supervision and Corrections Department for Grimes County before returning to his passion for service in hospitality. Josh currently is employed at Camp Allen Conference and Retreat Center. He serves as the Director of Conference Center Services which puts him in contact with over 54,000 guests a year to the Navasota area. Josh enjoys working directly with guests to ensure a safe and enjoyable stay. Josh comes from a long line of previous councilman and public servants. With a lifelong connection to the community he has been taught to treat others as he would want to be treated, and to serve wholeheartedly to all. Josh began volunteering for his community at age 10.
  • Navasota Theatre Alliance, President (age 17)
  • Navasota Blues Fest, Board Member
  • Jerry Lewis MDA Telethon, Fundraising Volunteer
  • Navasota City Manager Selection Committee
  • Texas Chargers (Charge Syndrome), Vice-President
  • Stone Ridge HOA, President
  • City of Navasota, Councilman
Bernie Gessner
bgessner@navasotatx.gov Phone: (936) 825-6475 Bernie Gessner was born on November 12, 1936 in Wilmington, Delaware and raised in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and Hyattsville, Maryland. Bernie graduated in 1958 from University of Notre Dame with a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering and commissioned into the U.S. Navy. In 1966, Bernie married Carol Jean Lindley, a Navasota native and proceeded to have seven children (and now have 10 grandchildren). Bernie resigned from the Navy in August 1970 and moved to Navasota, where he has resided ever since. Bernie brings great industry and business knowledge to the Council as he managed Sorrell Manufacturing Company in Navasota for 18 months, owned and operated several small businesses in Bryan and College Station (31 years) eventually retiring from the business world in 2003. Bernie has been a great community volunteer serving four years on Navasota Planning and Zoning Commission before being elected to City Council in May of 2008. To contact Bernie Gessner, please email Susie Homeyer or call (936) 825-6475 ext.107.
Kenneth Stevens

kstevens@navasotatx.gov Phone: (936) 825-6475 Kenneth Stevens is a native Texan, having had a career as a professional in the energy sector.  He is president of CnHn Strategies LLC, an oil and refined products trading firm.

Formerly an executive with the General Electric Company, in early 2018, Mr. Stevens was appointed, by U.S. Secretary of Energy, Rick Perry, as Senior Advisor for Western Hemisphere affairs and served through February of 2021.  He held TS/SCI security clearances advising USDOE leadership and staff, other Federal agencies, the National Security Council, and the White House on the full range of the Office's responsibilities regarding U.S. participation in international energy and environmental policy, investment, and trade issues in Western Hemisphere.

In 2021, Mr. Stevens was appointed by Texas Lt. Governor Dan Patrick to the State Energy Plan Advisory Committee.
